intro: Xanthobrychis ptolemaica, commonly known as the Ptolemaic moss, is a rare and ancient species of liverwort belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky crevices or on the bark of old trees. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are inconspicuous and contribute to its limited distribution. Due to its rarity and ecological specificity, Xanthobrychis ptolemaica is considered a valuable indicator of undisturbed, ancient habitats.
